paper_abstract: A graph G is called (H; k)-vertex stable if G contains a subgraph isomorphic to H ever after removing any k of its vertices. By stab(H; k) we denote the minimum size among the sizes of all (H; k)-vertex stable graphs. In this paper we present a first (non-trivial) general lower bound for stab(H; k) with regard to the order, connectivity and minimum degree of H. This bound is nearly sharp for k = 1.
paper_title: General lower bound on the size of (H; k)-stable graphs
